Posts.Content: wheatwoman wrote: I am looking for some advice from those who have walked in my shoes before me.  A couple of weeks ago as I was getting into the shower after mowing the grass and as I was pulling my shirt over my head - I happened to catch a glance at my breast and noticed that my left breast had a dimple.  I raised my arms and flexed - dimple still there; leaned forward - dimple still there.  ~Insert confession here.....All my life (I am 51) I have been horrible about doing sbe and never paid any attention to my boobs unless I was making sure they looked good in a shirt.~  Back to my boob - I also notice that my nipple was starting to pull in on one side and it appears that my left armpit seems swollen.  I had a dear friend that has since passed from bc and she always told me - pay attention to lumps, but the heed the warning of a dimple.  I immediately did an exam and thought that my boob felt different near my cleavage.  Called my GP straight away.  Saw her last week - she made a call and scheduled my for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound.  Had those procedures yesterday.  They found a spot (not where my GP or myself felt) which they want to watch and said is probably benign - would like for me to watch the nipple and dimple for any changes and do a follow-up in diagnostic mammogram in 6 months.  They also indicated that the area in my armpit was a combo of a new fat deposit and muscle. I have read several threads and some say wait; others say press forward for an mri.  I am so confused.  Don't want to discuss with my family as I don't want to worry them and yet I am slightly scared because I just keep hearing Dort's words play over and over in my head.   Any advice that you can provide would be so helpful.  I apologize for this being so long and again thanks. Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2012 09:52AM wheatwoman wrote: Thanks so much for the replies....quick update.  A second dimple is beginning to appear on my left breast so I went to my GP yesterday.  She has asked me to up my calcium dosage, stop drinking coffee, get new bras, and to start taking evening primrose for pain.  I am also having dull pain between my shoulder which sometimes turns to stabbing pain - so she prescribed an anti-inflammatory.  Have an appointment with breast surgeon/specialist on the 16th.....not sure what to think???  Any thoughts??  Could it really just be my bra and coffee intake???  Thanks again for your time and space for me to get my thoughts out of my head if only for a few minutes :0)
